snippet: The real obstacle to prosecuting excessive violence in sports may be our culture’s macho conception of athletes, who are expected to “man up” in the face of threats to their safety.
abstract: Op-Ed article by sports lawyer Eldon L Ham cites the New Orleans Saints' recently exposed bounty program, where bonuses were paid to players who injured opposing players on the field; says such bounties are part of a long history of similarly cruel tactics in sports; warns hands-off mentality that immunizes sports from criminal law is enabling more mayhem in America, not less.
lead_paragraph: The real obstacle to prosecuting excessive violence in sports may be our culture’s macho conception of athletes, who are expected to “man up” in the face of threats to their safety.
